news.title: US lawmakers release Epstein 'birthday book' with alleged Trump note
news.summary: The White House says the president did not draw the picture or sign the note, after it was published on Monday.

news.title: Mandelson 'called Epstein best pal' in letter
news.summary: The description is contained an alleged 50th "birthday book" given to the disgraced financier that has been released by US lawmakers.

news.title: Chris Mason: Rayner's replacement will show which way political wind is blowing in Labour
news.summary: Nominations for the new deputy leader of the Labour Party open today with a winner announced on 25 October.

news.title: 'I'm angry. It's not right' - locals want asylum hotels shut, but are shared houses the answer?
news.summary: The BBC's UK editor, Ed Thomas, meets local people and asylum seekers in two towns in north-west England.

news.title: Ofsted to bring in 'report card' school inspections despite criticism
news.summary: A new monitoring system will also be introduced, so schools can improve negative grades more quickly.

news.title: Best and worst-performing NHS Trusts in England named
news.summary: The new league tables score trusts on measures including finances and patient access to care.

news.title: First photos of site where New Zealand bushman hid children released
news.summary: Police also found a stash of firearms and ammunition at the campsite surrounded by dense vegetation.

news.title: Nepal lifts social media ban after 19 killed in protests
news.summary: Thousands had taken to the streets demanding that the government lift the ban and tackle corruption.

news.title: Anastacia: Arnold Schwarzenegger made me sing Whatta Man 12 times
news.summary: As she celebrates 25 years in music, Anastacia reflects on the gigs she played on her way to the top.

news.title: The Papers: 'Visa threat' on illegal immigration and 'warring princes'
news.summary: The home secretary's threat to suspend visas for countries that refuse to take back illegal migrants and the Duke of Sussex's visit to the UK lead Tuesday's papers.
